SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Admin Experience: More Easily Manage Storefront Data in Your Org

Equip your admins with better tools for managing your org's B2B Commerce for Visualforce data. Simplify the process of setting up new storefronts and upgrading to new releases or patches. And, admins whose native language is Japanese can now enjoy a more efficient experience with a localized CC Admin.

Load Global and Storefront Data Separately
To simplify how you load custom settings, custom object records, and configuration settings, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now loads global data separately from storefront-specific data. The CC Admin | Global Settings | Data Loader page also now accepts a JSON static resource instead of an XML static resource for both global and storefront data. And, to help avoid any unwanted loss of partial storefront data, the Delete All button is no longer available on this page.
Keep Your Global Data Up-to-Date After Upgrading
Have confidence that your upgrade has completed successfully. B2B Commerce for Visualforce now checks for missing global custom settings records and configuration settings when you upgrade.
Account for Changed Default Admin Permission Set
The B2B Commerce Admin permission set no longer includes the Customize Application permission by default. This change adds a level of security to your org’s data and improves performance of the managed package.
Provide a Localized Admin Experience
For admin users whose Language setting isn't English, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now provides a localized experience in Salesforce. CC Admin labels, menus, and configuration settings are now translatable. Outside of CC Admin, B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package information, including its custom objects and fields, are also translatable. By default, B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides Japanese translations, but you can add your own languages.
